summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twentieth Avenue Northwest, from West Sixty-fifth Street to Sloop Place, in the City of Seattle, by regrading and curbing the same, and constructing concrete walks thereon, in accordance with Resolution No. 1261 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
